Package thatslife

Class ThatsLife

java.lang.Object
thatslife.ThatsLife
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ThatsLife
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
That's Life (inspired by the board game "The Game of Life") This class is the master That's Life game class. It holds all the life cycles of all the classes.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • serializeUID

      public static final long serializeUID
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • FILEEXT

      public static final java.lang.String FILEEXT
      This is the supported file extension for save games
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • args

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> args
      This static attribute contains some game arguments that some of the game classes would take. An example of such argument is the norng argument, which inhibits the use of RNG when dealing with player spin. As such, the player will enter a number rather than spin for a random one.

  • Constructor Details

    • ThatsLife

      public ThatsLife​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerNames)
      A game is instantiated given the number of players for the game. The constructor initializes all the players, the map, and all card decks.
      Parameters:
      playerNames - An ArrayList of the player names to be used to instantiate the game. playerNames.size() will be used to determine the number of players.

    • ThatsLife

      public ThatsLife​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerNames, GameWindowController c)
      This constructor includes the JFX GameWindowController instance as parameter. It calls the previous contructor.
      Parameters:
      playerNames - An ArrayList of type String that contains the player names
      c - The instance of the controller to be used for this game instance.

  • Method Details

    • getMap

      public Map getMap()
      This method returns the map instance for this instance of the game.
      Returns:
      map : Map

    • getTurn

      public int getTurn()
      This method returns the value for which player's turn it currently is.
      Returns:
      turn : int

    • getPlayerString

      public java.lang.String getPlayerString​(int index)
      This method returns a player's information, based on the Player class' toString method.
      Parameters:
      index - - The index of the player in the player array. Must be 0 - nPlayers - 1.
      Returns:
      playerData : String

    • getPlayerTransactions

      public Transaction[] getPlayerTransactions​(int index)
      This method returns an array of the player's past transactions.
      Parameters:
      index - - The index of the player in the list of players
      Returns:
      Transaction[] - The array of the player's past transactions.

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      This method returns the number of players in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of players in the active game.

    • getDecks

      public Deck[] getDecks()
      This method returns the instances for all card decks in the game.
      Returns:
      card decks

    • startTurn

      public int startTurn​(int n)
      This method initiates a player's turn. It returns the player index for the next turn.
      Parameters:
      n - : The number of spaces to move.
      Returns:
      nextTurn : int

    • isOngoing

      public boolean isOngoing()
      This method checks if the game is still ongoing by checking the final space of the map if it holds all the players. It returns a boolean value that represents the game state.
      Returns:
      isOnGoing : boolean

    • declareRanking

      public java.lang.String declareRanking()
      This method returns the single String that contains the final ranking for all players after the game. This method should only be called once the isOnGoing() method return false.
      Returns:
      rank : String

    • getFinalBalance

      public double[] getFinalBalance()
      This method returns the final balances of all players when the game is over, in the order prescribed by the declareRanking() method.
      Returns:
      Balances : double[]

    • addGameArgs

      public static void addGameArgs​(java.lang.String arg)
      This method adds arguments to the game's static arguments class variable. These arguments are used to inhibit/customize certain game behaviors.
      Parameters:
      arg - : String - argument to add.

    • rollNumber

      public static int rollNumber()
      This is the main random number generator for the game. It "spins" and generates a number from [1,10].
      Returns:
      An integer corresponding to the randomly generated number.

    • getDeck

      public static Deck getDeck​(int index)
      This method returns the instance of the card deck given the index. 0 - Career Deck 1 - Salary Deck 2 - Blue Deck 3 - Action Deck 4 - House Deck
      Parameters:
      index - : int - index of the deck
      Returns:
      deck : Deck

    • setDeck

      public static void setDeck​(Deck[] deck)
      This method sets the session deck list.
      Parameters:
      deck - : The deck set to use

    • saveGame

      public static boolean saveGame​(ThatsLife game, java.lang.String filepath)
      This method allows the user to save the instance of the game in a binary file unique to this program implementation.
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of the game.
      filepath - The filepath for the save location.
      Returns:
      Boolean representation if the game was successfully saved or otherwise.

    • loadGame

      public static ThatsLife loadGame​(java.lang.String filepath) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method allows the user to load a serialized instance of a game and continue playing it.
      Parameters:
      filepath - The filepath for the saved game binary file.
      Returns:
      Returns the instance of the ThatsLife game.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - : General exception

    • setSessionJFXController

      public static void setSessionJFXController​(GameWindowController c)
      This sets the session's JavaFX controller.
      Parameters:
      c - : The JFX controller class to set.

    • getSessionJFXController

      public static GameWindowController getSessionJFXController()
      This returns the reference to the instance of the game's JavaFX controller.
      Returns:
      : The game's assigned JFX controller class.
